glsa.title: Evolution: Integer overflow in camel-lock-helper
glsa.synopsis: An overflow in the camel-lock-helper application can be exploited by an attacker to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

background.p: Evolution is a GNOME groupware application similar to Microsoft Outlook.

description.p: Max Vozeler discovered an integer overflow in the camel-lock-helper application, which is installed as setgid mail by default.

impact.p: A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute malicious code with the privileges of the 'mail' group. A remote attacker could also setup a malicious POP server to execute arbitrary code when an Evolution user connects to it.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Evolution users should upgrade to the latest version:
